      • knearest

        public void knearest(java.io.File dataset,
                     double[] newDataPoint,
                     int k)
        Given a dataset, a new data point, and a parameter k, your solution will need to find the k data points that are closest to the new data point as per your Euclidean similarity function, and choose the most common class among them to classify the new data point.
        Parameters:
        dataset - File, containing the dataset for a supervised learning algorithm.
        newDataPoint - double array, contains five points
        k - int, number of data points to check proximity with

      • csvToList

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> csvToList(java.io.File dataset)
        Converts a csv file to an arrayList with a List of strings inside. The reason I used a List instead of an ArrayList is apparent on line 140. This crucial
        Parameters:
        dataset - File, csv file to convert to a data type
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Lists with data type String, represents the data points and the class they belong to

      • listToArray

        private java.lang.String[][] listToArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> dataList,
                                         double[] newDataPoint)
        This method converts the dataList into a 2D array for sorting purposes. This 2D array is a list of pair values in the form [the euclidean distance between the newDataPoint and the points in the dataList, class of point in dataList]
        Parameters:
        dataList - ArrayList of Lists with data type String, represents the data points and the class they belong to.
        newDataPoint - double array, contains five points
        Returns:
        2D Array that consists of the euclidean distance and the class that the value found the distance between

      • orderArray

        private void orderArray(java.lang.String[][] dataArray)
        Method that orders the 2D array by using Insertion Sort. Orders the array by euclidean distance
        Parameters:
        dataArray - 2D array [the euclidean distance between the newDataPoint and the points in the dataList, class of point in dataList]

      • calcClosest

        private void calcClosest(java.lang.String[][] dataArray,
                         int k)
        Calculates is the new data point is closer to class1 or class2
        Parameters:
        dataArray - 2D sorted array in form [the euclidean distance between the newDataPoint and the points in the dataList, class of point in dataList]
        k - int, number of data points to check proximity with
